intro: Lotononis lupinifolia var. eu-lupinifolia, commonly known as the slender lupin, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is a hardy perennial that is well-suited for coastal and Mediterranean climates.
